intro: Vandesia edulis, commonly known as the edible orchid, is a tropical plant native to regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are broad and革质, providing efficient water retention in its natural habitat. While primarily appreciated for its ornamental value, certain parts of the plant are edible and used in local cuisines.
